# Pushing boundaries

Our world-class research team continues to explore the horizon of zero-
knowledge, tokenomics, security, and more.

![](/static/cyclone-115ff7a472035a94e380bc00c5a73a87.svg)

## Cyclone

Zero-knowledge (ZK) proofs are quickly becoming a core primitive for
blockchains as a means for enabling the development of highly-scalable
distributed systems and privacy-enabled applications. Hence, low-latency proof
generation is critical to the success of ZKs. Discover how we married our
expertise in hardware and FPGA design with our experience in crypto to help
accelerate core components of these proof systems. The code is open-source,
and we're excited to be contributing to the future of zero-knowledge.

[.Read the announcement](/accelerating-msm/)

## Research

We’re actively working with the research community to drive various efforts in
the Zero Knowledge space forward. Discover some of our most recent work below:

![Aptos World
Tour](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)

##### FPGA Acceleration of Multi-Scalar Multiplication: CycloneMSM

[.Learn more](/research/fpga-acceleration-of-multi-scalar-multiplication-
cyclonemsm/)

![Aptos World
Tour](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)

#####  CycloneNTT: An NTT/FFT Architecture Using Quasi-Streaming of Large
Datasets on DDR- and HBM-based FPGA Platforms

[.Learn more](/research/cyclonentt-an-ntt-fft-architecture-using-quasi-
streaming-of-large-datasets-on-ddr-and-hbm-based-fpga-platforms/)
